Lansing.Lansing Metal Center: The Lansing Metal Center was a General Motors foundry located in Lansing Township, Michigan directly across Saginaw Street from the Lansing Craft Center. It was originally built as a jet engine manufacturing plant in 1952 and shuttered in 2006. Upon its closing, the plant was 1,590,000 square feet (148,000 m2) in size, and employed 1,200.
